runs.comm: fullish ball on the stumps, and it's driven down towards mid-on
full ball on off, and he drives it back to the bowler before backing away as Badree lets loose a throw back at the stumps
quickish length ball on the stumps, and he pokes it back to the bowler
length ball on off, and he takes a big step forward to drive to mid-off
slides on with the angle, might have even been the googly, and he chops this attempted cut down onto the pitch
straight roller on off and middle, and he defends down the ground
this was seam-up, and it shaped away a hint as Neesham aimed a big cover drive at it and missed
effortless! That was a length ball outside off, and he's swung lazily through the line to dump that over the long-on boundary
another length ball, closer to off stump this time, and he leans forward and drives this crisply to the left of mid-off. Top shot
slower ball outside off, and he comes forward and waits before pushing it out to point
bowled him! That's a good ball, much fuller, right up in the blockhole, in fact, and much closer to off, and he tries to drive without moving his feet and drags an inside-edge onto his stumps.
very full, and a bit of shape in towards McCullum's toes, and he drives carefully to mid-off
down the pitch, and that's a nice-looking pick-up shot over midwicket and to the right of long-on
back of a length outside off, and McCullum steers it towards point off the back foot
length ball outside off and McCullum is beaten trying to sweep. Ramdin appeals after taking off the bails. They go up to the third umpire, but his foot was tethered firmly an inch behind the crease
length ball on the pads, and he nurdles it towards mid-on
down the pitch, makes some room to go over the off side, but he gets too close to the pitch of the ball and hits it hard but straight to mid-off
length ball, a touch too straight, and he gets nicely across and laps it to the fine leg boundary
fires this in quick, and slips it down the leg side
turns away sharply, from a shortish length, and McCullum pushes it defensively towards point
fullish ball on leg stump, straightened a touch, and he defends carefully back to the bowler
straightened again from middle stump, and he pushes it down towards long-on off the back foot
turns in this time, and he goes back and defends into the off side
length ball on off stump, turns in, and he tucks it neatly to short fine leg
not particularly short, but Baz doesn't need it to be too short to swivel into that pull of his. Rocks back and connects reasonably well but deep midwicket is in place to cut that off
jumps down the track, and Santokie sees this and slides this wide outside off. McCullum slaps it to mid-off
stays still this time, and it's full and wide once again, and he swings cleanly through the line to launch that over extra cover. Lands just beyond the ropes
shortish ball, and definitely short enough for McCullum's pull. Just helps this, really, one bounce over the deep backward square leg boundary

bish, bash, bosh! That's a lot of tosh from Santokie, short and wide, and he slaps this hard past a diving point fielder. Pollard looks like he's hurt his left shoulder, and the drizzle seems to have intensified
fuller now, and he's made room to play a nice inside-out drive that might have earned him another boundary had the outfield not been as slow as this one is
length ball on middle stump, and he opens his bat face to steal a smart single just in front of Darren Bravo, who fumbles as he runs in from backward point
giving nothing away with that off-side line and slight inward angle. Defended back to the bowler
a touch shorter now and he shuffles across to tuck it off his pads to deep square leg
down the pitch and gets inside the line to play the inside-out lofted drive but long-off cuts it off at the boundary, running to his left
shortish ball, outside off, and he rocks back to slap it to the deep cover fielder
slower this time, and he fetches this sweep from wide outside off stump, down towards deep backward square leg
pushed through, and he makes room to slash this from off stump to deep cover
starts with shortish ball on off stump, he delivered this from behind the stumps, and he slaps this to deep cover
another shortish ball on off, another slap to deep cover
low full-toss outside off, and he miscues this heave and sends it rolling down to midwicket
jumps down the pitch, giving himself room, and Russell sees this and fires in a wide yorker outside off. Smart thinking, and Baz can only let it go through to the keeper
in the blockhole again and he can't get any elevation on this, rolls down to long-on
Williamson gives himself room this time, and once again he foils the batsman's plans by bowling it nice and wide of off, close to the tramlines but just inside them
onto the pads, and it's tucked away to short fine leg
shortish ball outside off, and he drags this pull down to wide long-on
spins away from off stump, and McCullum opens his bat face and steers it down towards third man
short, and McCullum is back in a flash to pull it ruthlessly to the right of deep midwicket. Picked up the length so quickly there
;length ball on off stump, and McCullum brings out the big forward press and defensive push into the covers
back of a length this time, and he goes back and works it towards midwicket
and starts with a short ball outside off. Williamson pulls and Pollard runs to his right from deep midwicket to stop it on the boundary
angled in towards middle-and-leg, and he pushes it with a straight bat down to long-on
shortish ball once again, outside off, and Pollard has to run to his left this time to cut off that pull

shot! that was a length  ball, angled in towards off stump, and he gave himself a tiny bit of room to free his arms and punched it with a straight bat back over the bowler's head, and they're checking if it landed inside the boundary rope or on it... I think it's landed on the rope, but they've given four

And Sammy's done the trick! It was the slower ball, and Williamson closed his face early, and the ball looped high over Sammy, who leapt up in his follow-through and took a super overhead catch with his left hand.
back of a length, outside off, and he goes back and across to push that down to long-on
slower ball outside off, and he pushes forward to drive to deep cover
slower ball on off stump, nice and full, and he drives down to long-on
back of a length, and he tucks it down off his hips towards midwicket
short, outside off, and he gets a lot of tennis-ball bounce. It's well over head-high and the umpire calls a wide
closes his bat face too early as he tries to flick this, and gets a leading edge that runs away towards point
angled down the leg side, and it goes off his pad down to fine leg as he misses the flick
back of a length, tight line just outside off, and he guides it down to third man off the back foot
length ball on off, and he didn't seem to connect too cleanly with that lofted hit, but it just kept going and sailed way over the long-on boundary
full and wide outside off this time, and Taylor chases it but is beaten by extra bounce
full and wide once more, and Taylor is nicely in line this time to help that over the wide long-off boundary with just a little wave of his bat

dropped, was  he? Short ball outside off and he pulled that extremely hard and straight to Badree at midwicket, who wrings his hands after the ball bounces off them. I'm not sure if it went to him on the full or on the bounce
shorter still, and he doesn't get too clean a slice of this, but gets enough bat on it for the ball to go one bounce over the deep square leg boundary
onto the pads, and it's worked down to wide long-on
fullish ball on off stump, and he comes forward to play a checked drive to long-on
back of a length outside off, and it's steered behind point
straightens from middle stump, and he defends back to the bowler off the front foot
big appeal as this turns sharply away and beats McCullum's attempt at slapping this square on the off side. Replays show there was quite some distance between outside edge and ball
bit of bounce, and he takes his bottom hand off and gets an inside-edge down towards backward square leg
full and wide, and he comes forward to drive that to deep cover
thickish outside edge as he tries to drive towards cover, slices it down to short third man
Sammy strikes again! It's short, and McCullum pulls, but for once he doesn't get hold of it and it goes uppishly and drops comfortably into the hands of Dwayne Smith at deep square leg
full ball, angling in towards off, and he defends back to the bowler
full, on off, and he walks across his stumps and works it behind square on the leg side
short, rising to chest-height, and he clubs it down to deep midwicket
slower ball, full and angled across towards off stump, and he drives it to deep cover
that's a shocking delivery. He lost his action there, and it slipped out of his hand, with no pace at all, and way down the leg side
onto middle stump now, length ball, and he tucks it gently into the midwicket area with a roll of his wrists
slower ball, very short, and he thought about cutting initially, but it barely came on, and decided in the end to club it down to long-on
back of a length, angling in towards off, and he shuffles across and tucks it off his hip to deep midwicket
full, on off stump, right in Anderson's slot, and he swats across the line and launches it over the deep midwicket boundary
short ball, and Anderson semi-ducks, semi-sways out of the way
full ball outside off, and he shuffles forward to play a checked drive towards deep cover
short ball, and Anderson was late on the pull. Caught it high on the bat and it looped up but safely enough, dropping down near where mid-on would have been had he not been stationed at long-on
into the blockhole, and he swings hard at it but can't even get it off the square
full-toss, and he swats it over the bowler's head, two bounces down past the boundary. It was the slower ball, and it slipped out of his grasp
Sammy has three now. He bangs this in, and it goes looping off Anderson's outside edge as he looks to pull. Easy catch for Narine at short fine leg
shortish ball outside off, and he chops down on it and sends it speeding away wide of Narine at short third man, but he gives chase and cuts it off easily enough
